articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Pope calls for dialogue and restraint amid growing US-Iran tensions
articles.description: Pope Francis called on Sunday for dialogue and restraint two days after the killing of a top Iranian military commander by the United States.
articles.content:
MILAN (Reuters) - Pope Francis called on Sunday for dialogue and restraint two days after the killing of a top Iranian military commander by the United States. 
Speaking at the Sunday Angelus prayer at the Vatican, the pope did not mention Iran by name but s… [+469 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Daimler, Volvo mull combustion engine cooperation -report
articles.description: Luxury German carmaker Daimler and Volvo Cars, owned by China's Geely, are considering cooperating to cut the costs of developing combustion engines, a magazine reported on Sunday, citing unnamed company sources.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - Luxury German carmaker Daimler (DAIGn.DE) and Volvo Cars, owned by China’s Geely, are considering cooperating to cut the costs of developing combustion engines, a magazine reported on Sunday, citing unnamed company sources. 
The Automobilw… [+1747 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Spain's Sanchez loses first bid to get parliament backing to form government
articles.description: Spanish Socialist leader Pedro Sanchez failed on Sunday in a first attempt to get parliament's backing to form a government, leaving him two days to secure support to end an eight-month political gridlock.
articles.content:
MADRID (Reuters) - Spanish Socialist leader Pedro Sanchez failed on Sunday in a first attempt to get parliament’s backing to form a government, leaving him two days to secure support to end an eight-month political gridlock. 
Sanchez, who has been acting pri… [+583 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi Aramco shares hit lowest since IPO, down 1.7%
articles.description: Shares of Saudi Aramco were down 1.7% in late afternoon trade on Sunday, hitting 34.55 riyals ($9.21) per share, its lowest level since it started trading last month after a record initial public offering (IPO).
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Shares of Saudi Aramco were down 1.7% in late afternoon trade on Sunday, hitting 34.55 riyals ($9.21) per share, its lowest level since it started trading last month after a record initial public offering (IPO). 
The shares reacted to acros… [+378 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump vows to hit 52 sites if Iran retaliates
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump says he's ready to strike 52 sites in Iran if the country retaliates over the killing of top general Qassem Soleimani. Julian Satterthwaite reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
U.S. President Donald Trump says he's ready to strike 52 sites in Iran if the country retaliates over the killing of top general Qassem Soleimani. Julian Satterthwaite reports.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Raab raises concerns with Cyprus about Briton found guilty of gang rape lie
articles.description: British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday he had raised concerns with his Cypriot counterpart about the treatment of a British woman found guilty by a court in Cyprus of lying about being gang-raped by a group of Israeli youths.
articles.content: LONDON (Reuters) - British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday he had raised concerns with his Cypriot counterpart about the treatment of a British woman found guilty by a court in Cyprus of lying about being gang-raped by a group of Israeli youths. … [+1698 chars]

articles.title: Netanyahu, in apparent stumble, calls Israel 'nuclear power'
articles.description: In an apparent slip of the tongue on Sunday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described Israel as a nuclear power before correcting himself with a bashful nod and an embarrassed smile.
articles.content:
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - In an apparent slip of the tongue on Sunday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described Israel as a nuclear power before correcting himself with a bashful nod and an embarrassed smile.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Swiss oppose drive to end free movement of EU citizens - poll
articles.description: Most Swiss oppose a referendum campaign launched by the far right to end the free movement of citizens from the European Union, a poll published on Sunday found.
articles.content:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Most Swiss oppose a referendum campaign launched by the far right to end the free movement of citizens from the European Union, a poll published on Sunday found. 
The referendum drive reflects unease with the influx of foreigners, who now … [+2074 chars]

articles.title: Gulf markets plunge on U.S.-Iran tensions, Aramco hits lowest since IPO
articles.description: Gulf stocks fell sharply in late afternoon trade on Sunday, with Kuwaiti and Saudi stocks leading losses.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Gulf stocks fell sharply in late afternoon trade on Sunday, with Kuwaiti and Saudi stocks leading losses.

articles.title: EU's Borrell invites Iran's foreign affairs minister to Brussels
articles.description: European Union's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell urged a de-escalation of tensions in the Middle East in a talk with Iran's Foreign Affairs Minister Javad Zarif over the weekend, an EU statement said on Sunday.
articles.content:
BRUSSELS (Reuters) - European Union’s foreign policy chief Josep Borrell urged a de-escalation of tensions in the Middle East in a talk with Iran’s Foreign Affairs Minister Javad Zarif over the weekend, an EU statement said on Sunday.

articles.title: Japanese woman turns 117 years old, extends record as world's oldest person
articles.description: Kane Tanaka has extended her record as the world's oldest person by celebrating her 117th birthday at a nursing home in Fukuoka in southern Japan.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Kane Tanaka has extended her record as the world’s oldest person by celebrating her 117th birthday at a nursing home in Fukuoka in southern Japan.
